docs.title: rio-faux
docs.text:
Now you can share your dataset!

Documentation: cogeotiff.github.io/rio-faux/

Source Code: cogeotiff/rio-faux

Create a copy of your dataset without copying the data.

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
$ pip install -U pip
$ pip install rio-faux

Or install from source:

$ pip install -U pip
$ pip install git+https://github.com/cogeotiff/rio-faux.git

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
$ rio faux --help
Usage: rio faux [OPTIONS] INPUT OUTPUT

  Create empty copy.

Options:
  --forward-band-tags         Forward band tags to output bands.
  --forward-dataset-tags      Forward dataset tags to output image.
  --co, --profile NAME=VALUE  Driver specific creation options. See the documentation for the selected output driver for more information.
  --config NAME=VALUE         GDAL configuration options.
  --help                      Show this message and exit.


$ rio faux tests/fixtures/cog_band_tags.tif out.tif

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Issues and pull requests are more than welcome.

dev install

$ git clone https://github.com/cogeotiff/rio-faux.git
$ cd rio-faux
$ pip install -e .["test","dev"]
You can then run the tests with the following command:

python -m pytest --cov rio_faux --cov-report term-missing

docs.title: pre-commit
docs.text:
This repo is set to use pre-commit to run isort, flake8, pydocstring, black ("uncompromising Python code formatter") and mypy when committing new code.

$ pre-commit install

docs.title: Docs
docs.text:
$ git clone https://github.com/cogeotiff/rio-faux.git
$ cd rio-faux
$ pip install -e .["docs"]

Hot-reloading docs:

$ mkdocs serve

To manually deploy docs (note you should never need to do this because Github Actions deploys automatically for new commits.):

$ mkdocs gh-deploy

• Fix issue with CLI path
  • add Alpha band value forwarding
  • add --value option to set a custom value in the data

• disable dataset tags forwarding by default and add --forward-dataset-tags options
  • band descriptions are only forwarded if --forward-band-tags is set
